Row.Text: Crowded Markets, Foreign Tongues

Crowds gather in your markets, and voices from many different lands ring out as deals are struck and bargains made. Some are angry about this and believe that foreigners will destroy our trade. Others, however, encourage the foreign business, hoping to learn from their culture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How do you feel about this?
Let the foreigners continue to trade.
For {4_Turns}, the Markets in all Cities benefit from the exotic trade, gaining +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture; however, overall taxes suffer and cost the local Treasury -1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Implement heavy taxes on imported goods.
For {4_Turns}, any Cities with a Market will gain +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from increased taxes.
Icons of Our Past

Monuments represent the most important symbols of your culture. Your people seek to celebrate this by dedicating your Monuments to either their ancestors or to their gods.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How do you feel about this? Choose from the following options:
Dedicate Monuments to our fertility.
For {4_Turns}, Monuments in all cities provide +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
The gods are what is important now.
For {4_Turns}, Monuments in all cities gain +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith.
Neither will suffice. The Monument should generate revenue.
For {4_Turns}, Monuments in all cities provide +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Death of a Merchant

A wealthy merchant in your empire has died, and he left behind an ambiguous will. His two sons, one a sailor and the other a banker, each have legal claim to the inheritance and have petitioned the State for resolution. What will you decide?
I don't care; however, I do intend to tax the inheritance.
+{2_InstantYield}.
The banker's case is more sound, as his investments match those of his father.
Receive a free Caravan in your Capital.
The sailor's ideas would benefit all of our coastal cities.
+{3_CityYieldGlobal} in all coastal Cities.
Exotic Luxuries
Scouts have uncovered an rare spice that is difficult to transport and reproduce. If we are willing to pay the steep expenses, the Empire can taste this exotic treat.[NEWLINE]
Alas we can't afford this. However, we can train our scouts to look for more luxuries like those.
All Scout units gain +20 XP.
Let's have it!
The novelty of the luxury provides +3 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for {4_Turns}. Transport costs will be {2_InstantYield} to bring the goods home.
[NEWLINE]Not enough gold! Better tell the scouts to look for more luxuries like these later on!
I'm not really interested in this. Let's sell it to the neighbors.
The sale of this spice bring a one-time windfall of {2_InstantYield} to the Treasury.
